oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stochastic resonance with a mesoscopic reaction-diffusion system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHARA, H
YAMAGUCHI, T
PARMANANDA, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: COUPLED CHEMICAL-REACTIONS
EXCITABLE SYSTEMS
SIMULATION
OSCILLATIONS
MECHANISM
DYNAMICS
PATTERNS
MODEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a mesoscopic reaction-diffusion system with an Oregonator reaction model, we show that intrinsic noise can drive a resonant stable pattern in the presence of the initial subthreshold perturbations. Both spatially periodic and aperiodic stochastic resonances are demonstrated by employing the Gillespies stochastic simulation algorithm. The mechanisms for these phenomena are discussed.
